title: Bug 108822 - More efficient disk sorting logic needed for border row values
OB: When sorting on disk, if there are 40000 rows of data and the program is set to process only a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows), the following operations are performed:
EB: Bug 108822 - More efficient logic is needed to process disk sorting when there are border row values. Instead of performing operations on the disk, the data should be sorted directly in memory and then written to the file.
SR:
1. Generate a file with 40000 rows of data.
2. Configure the program to process only a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows).
3. Sort the subset of data in memory.
4. Write the sorted data to the file in the destination folder.
